<Tytree>
<Hilda>
<Mao>
<Eugene>
<Claire>
<Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>「<Yellow>ふたつ<White>のカギとなるもの。それは……」
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>"The <Yellow>Two<White> keys. They are..."
Hack
Select
Razilda

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ・宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda - Inn - Grocery Store

Cress

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Blue>闇の力<White>というのは、 やはり言い伝えに過ぎないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Could the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> really be nothing more than a legend?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマで 話も食い違ってるしな。
Entry.EnglishText: Both sides had pretty different stories to tell.

Entry.JapaneseText: 聖なるものと、忌むべきもの。 泉……協力して残した地図…… ふたつに分けられたカギ……
Entry.EnglishText: Something divine, or an abomination. A spring... with a map born of cooperation that has remained, and a key split in two...

Entry.JapaneseText: ちぐはぐっていうか、 バラバラっていうか…… 今のこの街の様子がそのまま <Blue>闇の力<White>の話にも当てはまるネ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's hard to tell if the stories are inconsistent or if it's just one big mess... It makes sense that the tale of the <Blue>Power of Darkness<White> would be like that though, considering how this town is.
What's the matter, <Tytree>?
All of this just pisses me off!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここんところ、 ヒューマだ、ガジュマだ、 そんな話ばっかだと思わねぇか？
Entry.EnglishText: Haven't you guys noticed that the only things anyone talks about around here are "Huma this" or "Gajuma that?"

Entry.JapaneseText: ……おまえの気持ちは わかるような気がする……
Entry.EnglishText: I think I understand how you feel.

Entry.JapaneseText: だが、こうなっているのは、 ゲオルギアスと何か関係が あるんじゃないのか？ それが収まれば……
Entry.EnglishText: However, isn't it possible that what's going on here has some connection to Geyorkias? If we can figure out what that is, then...

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、例の石碑にそんな事が 書いてあったけどよ…… ホントにそれだけなのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, the steles did have something like that carved on them, but... Is that really the only thing wrong here?

Entry.JapaneseText: ひとごとじゃねえんだよ…… おれも……気になってるんだ…… 次から次へと考えちまうんだよ。 <Yellow>種族の違い<White>ってヤツを……
Entry.EnglishText: It's not just the people here! Even I... have started wondering about it. I can't stop thinking about the <Yellow>differences between both races<White>...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何で違うんだよ…… 何が違うっていうんだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Why are they different... And what makes them so different, anyway?!
E-excuse me, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Blue>闇の力<White>の事なんですけど、 ちょっと気になったというか…… この街には、<Yellow>ふたつ<White>のものが いくつもあるような……
Entry.EnglishText: ...This is going back to the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>, but there's something that caught my attention. There are many things in this town that come in <Yellow>twos<White>, are there not?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……泉を封じた<Cyan>カギ<White>は、 <Yellow>ふたつ<White>に分けられたんですよね？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Such as how the key to the spring was split in <Yellow>two<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: でしたら、 その<Yellow>ふたつ<White>を<Yellow>ひとつ<White>にしてみたら <Cyan>カギ<White>は見つかるのではないかと…… えっと……それだけです。
Entry.EnglishText: So perhaps if we were to combine those into <Yellow>one<White>, we might find the <Cyan>key<White> that we are looking for. Um... That's all...

Entry.JapaneseText: 言われてみると、確かに この街には、<Yellow>ふたつ<White>のものが多い。
Entry.EnglishText: Now that you mention it, a lot of things in this town do come in <Yellow>pairs<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふたつの種族…… <Blue>闇の力<White>のとらえかた…… 二人の種族長……
Entry.EnglishText: The two races and their views on the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>... and the two chiefs...

Entry.JapaneseText: 一体、どの<Yellow>ふたつ<White>を 組み合わせればいいのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: So how exactly are we supposed to put those together?

Entry.JapaneseText: カギとなるもの…… それは……
Entry.EnglishText: Something that could be used as a <Cyan>key<White>, which would be...
<Veigue>! What the heck are you saying!?
×××× is... No, it's... Nothing...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……今、何かヘンな事 言おうとしなかったか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hey. Were you going to say something weird just now?
I have no idea what you're talking about.

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん…… それじゃあ 困るんだよなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hm... That's kinda sus if you ask me...
The two tribes...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマ…… ふたつの種族が、それぞれ 持っているカギか……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma and Gajuma... The keys that each of the two tribes hold...
Song...

Entry.JapaneseText: あれは歌というよりも……
Entry.EnglishText: It's not a song, it's something else...
Flower...

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか……あれは…… 花の形をしていた……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah... That reminds me. In the shape of a flower...

Entry.JapaneseText: ふたつのカギ…… それは、カギだ……
Entry.EnglishText: The two keys... That's the key.

Entry.JapaneseText: そのまんまかよ！ しっかりしてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Throwing in the towel like that? Pull yourself together, man.
Cress...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ん？ もんしよう？ もんしょう？ もう一回言ってくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...? Cress? You mean Crest? Try that instead next time.
<Veigue>, hang in there.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふたつのもの…… ふたつの種族に伝わるもの……
Entry.EnglishText: Two things... The two pieces that have been passed down through each tribe's generations...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>闇の力<White>にまつわる何か、だよネ……
Entry.EnglishText: Something related to the <Blue>Dark Power<White>, I think...

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ…… この街に来ていくつかの話を 聞いたよな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh... You've heard some of the stories about coming to this city...

Entry.JapaneseText: この街にあるふたつのもの…… やっぱり一番大きなものは種族…… かしら。
Entry.EnglishText: Two things in this city... I think the biggest two are the tribes themselves... I wonder...

Entry.JapaneseText: それこそ、ガジュマとヒューマ、 ふたつに分けられたものが そのカギってヤツなんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: That's what the key is, isn't it? The key that separates the Gajuma and Huma?

Entry.JapaneseText: この街で見た何かと 関係するかもしれない……
Entry.EnglishText: It might have something to do with something we saw in this city...

Entry.JapaneseText: 思い出せ、族長の家で 何を見た？
Entry.EnglishText: Remember, what did you see at the Chief's house?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだ、<Veigue>！ きっと、旗に描かれた <Cyan>紋章<White>だよ！
Entry.EnglishText: That's it, <Veigue>! It must be the <Cyan>Crest<White> from the flags!

Entry.JapaneseText: この街に<Yellow>ふたつ<White>あるもの…… 種族ごとに持っているものは……
Entry.EnglishText: Something that this town has two of...and that both sides possess.
...The <Cyan>crests<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: それぞれの種族の旗…… あの旗に描かれている<Cyan>紋章<White>だ。
Entry.EnglishText: The <Cyan>crests<White> that are embroidered on the flags of each race.

Entry.JapaneseText: 詩だ。それぞれの種族の旗に まつわる詩はよく似ている。 詩が表す<Cyan>紋章<White>を組み合わせれば……
Entry.EnglishText: And the poems. The poems associated with each <Cyan>crest<White>are very alike. If we combine the <Cyan>crests<White> that represent them...

Entry.JapaneseText: それぞれの種族の<Cyan>紋章<White>？ あれをどう組み合わせる？
Entry.EnglishText: The <Cyan>crests<White> of each race? How are we supposed to combine those?
Well...

Entry.JapaneseText: 互い違いに合わせるのはどうだ？ どちらかを逆さまにすれば……
Entry.EnglishText: What if we just need to look at them from a different angle? How about flipping one around?

Entry.JapaneseText: これよ！ 私が宿屋で見たのは この<Cyan>紋章<White>が描かれた旗よ！
Entry.EnglishText: That's it! That was the <Cyan>crest<White> on the flag that I saw at the inn the first time!

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ!? じゃあ<Cyan>ラジルダの旗<White>っていうのは…… ふたつの種族の旗を組み合わせて 作られたものなんですか!?
Entry.EnglishText: What?! Then that means the <Cyan>Razildan Flag<White>...was made by combining the flags of both races?

Entry.JapaneseText: だとすれば、ふたつの種族が 協力して作ったという「地図」は、 この<Cyan>紋章<White>なのかもしれない。
Entry.EnglishText: If that's the case, then the map we're looking for may be the <Cyan>crest<White>s of the flags themselves.

Entry.JapaneseText: 待ってくれ、えっと…… それぞれの種族の<Cyan>紋章<White>に まつわる<Cyan>詩<White>ってのが<Cyan>カギ<White>で、 <Red>ラジルダの紋章<White>が地図って事か？
Entry.EnglishText: Hold on, wait... You guys are saying that the <Cyan>poems<White> that go with each flag are the <Cyan>keys<White>, and the <Cyan>crest<White> of the <Red>Razildan Flag<White> is the map?

Entry.JapaneseText: そう考えると、宿屋さんが 言ってた事も説明できます。
Entry.EnglishText: If it's true, then it aligns well with what the innkeeper told us.

Entry.JapaneseText: 確か…… 「時を越え、我らは共に歌う。 そこに道は開かれん」 だったよネ？
Entry.EnglishText: Let's see... "Across time, our voices harmonize. Therein, the path unties." That was it, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……つまり、この地図が示す泉で、 カギとなる<Cyan>詩<White>をひとつにしてうたえば、 <Blue>闇の力<White>を手に入れる事ができる。 そう考えられませんか……？
Entry.EnglishText: In other words, if we go to the spring and sing the two <Cyan>poems<White> as one, then they will become the key that opens the spring and leads to the <Blue>Dark Power<White>. That seems correct, doesn't it...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、それなら、すべての話が <Yellow>ひとつ<White>になる。
Entry.EnglishText: It does. And if that's true, then both stories combined become a complete <Yellow>one<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: でもよ、その泉は どこにあるんだよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Okay, but where is the spring supposed to be exactly?

Entry.JapaneseText: みんなで考えるんだ。 ヒューマとガジュマの<Cyan>紋章<White>が 地図ならば、その中に必ず 手がかりがあるはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's put our heads together. If the Huma and Gajuma <Cyan>crests<White> form the map, then there should be some sort of clue we can gleam from them.

Entry.JapaneseText: わかった!! 花だ!! <Cyan>紋章<White>に描かれた花が 泉の場所を示してるんだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: I've got it! The flowers! The flowers on the <Cyan>crests<White> show the location of the spring!
Where is it, then?

Entry.JapaneseText: そんなのわかんねーよ。 だけど、なんか今、四つの花が 咲いてる光景を思いついたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know THAT much. But for some reason a scene of those four flowers in bloom suddenly popped into my head.

Entry.JapaneseText: さぞかし素敵なお花畑でしょうね？ ……期待した私がバカだったわ。 そもそも、同じ場所に咲く花なの？ この四つって……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Well, wouldn't that be just lovely? I should've known better than to get my hopes up. Besides, how would those flowers even be growing in the same spot in the first place?

Entry.JapaneseText: ううーん…… だけど、最近、そういう景色を どっかで見たような気がするんだよ。 絵じゃなくて、本物を。
Entry.EnglishText: Agh... But I really feel like I saw something like that not too long ago. And not in a picture, but for real!

Entry.JapaneseText: どこですか？ もし、本当にそんな場所があるなら、 そこに泉があるかもしれませんよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Where? If such a place really exists, then that may be where the spring is located.
...It's no use, I can't remember!

Entry.JapaneseText: 外へ行ってみるか？ 何か思い出すかもしれない。
Entry.EnglishText: Why don't we walk around outside for a bit? Something might jog your memory.

Entry.JapaneseText: みんな本当にありがとう。 おかげ様でそんなひどいケガでも なかったし、もう大丈夫だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You guys saved me! Thanks to you, my ankle wasn't as bad as it could have been and I'm all better now.

Entry.JapaneseText: イゴルは帰っちまったのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Did Igor go back home?

Entry.JapaneseText: ずいぶん具合も良くなりましたし、 お父さんが軍に連れていかれて 大変だからって……
Entry.EnglishText: His condition had improved greatly, and he was saying that he was worried about his father being in military custody...

Entry.JapaneseText: ハックさんは大丈夫なんですか？ <Blue>闇の力<White>の事で、この街の ガジュマから追われてましたけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Hack, are you going to be all right? You were being pursued by the Gajuma in this town for your involvement with the <Blue>Power of Shade<White>...

Entry.JapaneseText: うん……おかげ様で…… ガジュマの族長も捕まっちゃったし、 街は軍に制圧されてこの騒ぎだから うやむやになっちゃったみたいだね。
Entry.EnglishText: I should be fine, thankfully. Since the Gajuma chief has been arrested and the town is now under the control of the army, I'm probably the last thing on their mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: この人から聞いたんだけど、 <Blue>闇の力<White>と<Yellow>聖なる鳥<White>の力を 手に入れたんだって？ 本当、びっくりだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: This young lady was telling me that you've obtained the <Blue>Power of Shade<White> as well as the Power of the <Yellow>Sacred Bird<White>. That was surprising to hear!

Entry.JapaneseText: それから、僕に聞きたい事が あるんだって？ 僕にわかる事なら何だって答えるよ。 助けてもらった恩も返してないしね。
Entry.EnglishText: With that, wasn't there something you were going to ask me? I'll tell you anything you want to know, assuming I know anything about it. I owe you guys, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「雲海にそびえし塔」と いうのに心当たりはないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you know anything about a “tower which soars above a sea of clouds?”

Entry.JapaneseText: 「雲海にそびえし塔」……？ それも君たちの探してるものと 関係があるんだね？
Entry.EnglishText: "A tower which soars above a sea of clouds...?" I take it that's related to something else you're looking for, hm?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだな……雲海っていうのは、 雲を上から見た様子だから…… その塔は、よほど背が高いとか 高い場所にあるって事だよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Let me think... A "sea of clouds" would mean that you'd be looking down on them from up above, so this tower is either extremely tall or located at a high altitude...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だったら、アレかな？ 確か、キョグエンのあたりに、 昔、山のはるか上に<Yellow>ヒト<White>が住んでたって いう言い伝えがあるんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: That gives me an idea! I recall there being legends of <Yellow>Human<White> settlements located high above the mountains surrounding Kyogen in ancient times,

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン…… 山のはるか上に住む<Yellow>ヒト<White>…… 可能性は否定できないわね。
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen... <Yellow>People<White> who lived high up in the mountains... We can't ignore the possibility, at the very least.

Entry.JapaneseText: 確かな話じゃなくて すまないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I wish I could provide you with something more substantial...

Entry.JapaneseText: ううん、助かったヨ。 また、何かあったらよろしくネ！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't sweat it, that's a huge help! If we need anything else, we'll be sure to drop by!

Entry.JapaneseText: ひとまず、キョグエンに行ってみよう。 北へ向かうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's go to Kyogen for the time being. It's to the north.

Entry.JapaneseText: このあいだは助けてくれて ありがとう。 何もお礼をしてなかったね。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for helping me the other day. I forgot my manners and didn't thank you at all.
Here, take this.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか不思議ないわれのある 杖らしいんだ。大切に使ってよ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's said to have a mysterious use. Take good care of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: いつもキミたちには 助けられてばっかりだよね。
Entry.EnglishText: You guys are always helping me out, aren't you?

Entry.JapaneseText: 前にあげた杖、 大切に使ってくれてる？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you taking good care of that cane I gave you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> はい いいえ 売った・捨てた 忘れていた
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Yes No Sold/Discarded it Forgot about it

Entry.JapaneseText: そっかあ、それはあげた かいがあったな。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh good, it was worth giving it to you guys then.

Entry.JapaneseText: またスゴイもの見つけたら あげるね。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll give it to you if I find another great one.

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ！ そうなの？ どうして？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh!? Really? Why would you do that?
It was a gift for you...
Huh!? What do you mean!?
You're so mean...

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、今日から 大切に使ってよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Okay then. From today, you'll have to take good care of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『宿帳』 訪問客の宿に対する感想などが 書かれているノート。 「良心的なおかみのいる宿屋、 少々ガジュマに肩入れする 感があるのは感心しない」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Inn Guestbook - A notebook in which a visitor's impressions of an inn are written. The innkeeper, with a conscientious wife, is not impressed by the fact that the inn seems to be a bit on the side of allying with Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ティーセット』 ラジルダ産近辺で採れた葉っぱで 入れたお茶。 ほのかな渋みと芳醇な香りをたたえた 高級感漂うお茶。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Tea Set - The tea is made with leaves from a nearby area of Razilda. It has a slight astringency and a mellow aroma, giving it a luxurious feel.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『懐かしき旅愁』 旅の思い出にと サニイタウン南部の山々を描いた作品。 特にこれと言った特徴のない風景画。 作者の平凡なる才能を端的に表している。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Nostalgic Travel Memories - This work depicts the mountains in the southern part of Sunnytown as a memory of traveling there. This is a landscape painting without any particular characteristics. It is a straightforward representation of the artist's mediocre talent.
